verses.kjv: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem one and thirty years.
verses.web: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Josiah was 8 years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem for 31 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the ways of David his father, and declined neither to the right hand, nor to the left.
verses.web: He did that which was right in LORD’s eyes, and walked in the ways of David his father, and didn’t turn away to the right hand or to the left.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he did what was right. He followed the example of his ancestor David and never strayed from it in any direction.

verses.kjv: For in the eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after the God of David his father: and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places, and the groves, and the carved images, and the molten images.
verses.web: For in the eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after the God of David his father; and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places, the Asherah poles, the engraved images, and the molten images.
verses.ct: In the 8th year of his reign, while he was still young, he began to seek the God of his ancestor David. By his 12th year, he started purging Judah and Jerusalem of the high places, the Asherah poles, and the carved and cast metal idols.

verses.kjv: And they brake down the altars of Baalim in his presence; and the images, that were on high above them, he cut down; and the groves, and the carved images, and the molten images, he brake in pieces, and made dust of them, and strowed it upon the graves of them that had sacrificed unto them.
verses.web: They broke down the altars of the Baals in his presence; and he cut down the incense altars that were on high above them. He broke the Asherah poles, the engraved images, and the molten images in pieces, made dust of them, and scattered it on the graves of those who had sacrificed to them.
verses.ct: Under his direction, the altars of Baal were torn down. He cut down the incense altars that stood above them. He smashed the Asherah poles and the carved and cast metal idols to dust, then scattered the debris over the graves of those who had offered sacrifices to them.

verses.kjv: And he burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars, and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.web: He burned the bones of the priests on their altars, and purged Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: He burned the bones of the pagan priests on their own altars, and in this way he cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And so did he in the cities of Manasseh, and Ephraim, and Simeon, even unto Naphtali, with their mattocks round about.
verses.web: He did this in the cities of Manasseh, Ephraim, and Simeon, even to Naphtali, around in their ruins.
verses.ct: He did the same thing in the cities of Manasseh, Ephraim, and Simeon, all the way to Naphtali, tearing through their ruins.

verses.kjv: And when he had broken down the altars and the groves, and had beaten the graven images into powder, and cut down all the idols throughout all the land of Israel, he returned to Jerusalem.
verses.web: He broke down the altars, and beat the Asherah poles and the engraved images into powder, and cut down all the incense altars throughout all the land of Israel, then returned to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: After he had demolished the altars, crushed the Asherah poles and carved images into powder, and cut down every incense altar throughout the entire land of Israel, he returned to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land, and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of the LORD his God.
verses.web: Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair LORD his God’s house.
verses.ct: In the 18th year of his reign, after he had finished purging the land and the temple, he sent Shaphan son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah son of Joahaz the recorder to repair the house of the LORD his God.

verses.kjv: And when they came to Hilkiah the high priest, they delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites that kept the doors had gathered of the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim, and of all the remnant of Israel, and of all Judah and Benjamin; and they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.web: They came to Hilkiah the high priest, and delivered the money that was brought into God’s house, which the Levites, the keepers of the threshold, had gathered from the hands of Manasseh, Ephraim, of all the remnant of Israel, of all Judah and Benjamin, and of the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: They went to Hilkiah the high priest and handed over the money that had been brought into God's house. The Levites who guarded the doors had collected it from the people of Manasseh, Ephraim, and the rest of Israel, as well as from all of Judah, Benjamin, and the residents of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And they put it in the hand of the workmen that had the oversight of the house of the LORD, and they gave it to the workmen that wrought in the house of the LORD, to repair and amend the house:
verses.web: They delivered it into the hands of the workmen who had the oversight of LORD’s house; and the workmen who labored in LORD’s house gave it to mend and repair the house.
verses.ct: They gave the money to the supervisors overseeing the work on the LORD's house, who then paid the laborers doing the repairs and restoration.

verses.kjv: Even to the artificers and builders gave they it, to buy hewn stone, and timber for couplings, and to floor the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.
verses.web: They gave it to the carpenters and to the builders, to buy cut stone and timber for couplings, and to make beams for the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.
verses.ct: They also gave money to the carpenters and builders to purchase cut stone and timber for beams and structural supports, to rebuild what the kings of Judah had allowed to fall apart.

verses.kjv: And the men did the work faithfully: and the overseers of them were Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites, of the sons of Merari; and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, to set it forward; and other of the Levites, all that could skill of instruments of musick.
verses.web: The men did the work faithfully. Their overseers were Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites, of the sons of Merari; and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, to give direction; and others of the Levites, who were all skillful with musical instruments.
verses.ct: The workers carried out their tasks faithfully. Their supervisors were Jahath and Obadiah, Levites from the family of Merari, along with Zechariah and Meshullam from the family of Kohath, who directed the work. Other Levites, all of them skilled musicians, also helped.

verses.kjv: Also they were over the bearers of burdens, and were overseers of all that wrought the work in any manner of service: and of the Levites there were scribes, and officers, and porters.
verses.web: Also they were over the bearers of burdens, and directed all who did the work in every kind of service. Of the Levites, there were scribes, officials, and gatekeepers.
verses.ct: They supervised the laborers who carried materials and directed everyone involved in any kind of work. Some of the Levites also served as scribes, officials, and gatekeepers.

verses.kjv: And when they brought out the money that was brought into the house of the LORD, Hilkiah the priest found a book of the law of the LORD given by Moses.
verses.web: When they brought out the money that was brought into LORD’s house, Hilkiah the priest found the book of LORD’s law given by Moses.
verses.ct: While the money stored in the LORD's house was being brought out, Hilkiah the priest discovered the book of the law of the LORD that had been given through Moses.

verses.kjv: And Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD. And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.
verses.web: Hilkiah answered Shaphan the scribe, “I have found the book of the law in LORD’s house.” So Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.
verses.ct: Hilkiah told Shaphan the scribe, "I've found the book of the law in the LORD's house!" Then he handed the book to Shaphan.

verses.kjv: And Shaphan carried the book to the king, and brought the king word back again, saying, All that was committed to thy servants, they do it.
verses.web: Shaphan carried the book to the king, and moreover brought back word to the king, saying, “All that was committed to your servants, they are doing.
verses.ct: Shaphan brought the book to the king and gave him a report: "Your servants are carrying out everything that was assigned to them.

verses.kjv: And they have gathered together the money that was found in the house of the LORD, and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers, and to the hand of the workmen.
verses.web: They have emptied out the money that was found in LORD’s house, and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers, and into the hand of the workmen.”
verses.ct: They've collected all the money that was found in the LORD's house and turned it over to the supervisors and the workers."

verses.kjv: Then Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath given me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.
verses.web: Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, “Hilkiah the priest has delivered me a book.” Shaphan read from it to the king.
verses.ct: Then Shaphan the scribe added, "Hilkiah the priest gave me a book." And Shaphan read from it aloud to the king.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the law, that he rent his clothes.
verses.web: When the king had heard the words of the law, he tore his clothes.
verses.ct: When the king heard the words of the law, he tore his clothes in distress.

verses.kjv: And the king commanded Hilkiah, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Abdon the son of Micah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah a servant of the king’s, saying,
verses.web: The king commanded Hilkiah, Ahikam the son of Shaphan, Abdon the son of Micah, Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king’s servant, saying,
verses.ct: The king gave orders to Hilkiah, Ahikam son of Shaphan, Abdon son of Micah, Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king's servant:

verses.kjv: Go, enquire of the LORD for me, and for them that are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning the words of the book that is found: for great is the wrath of the LORD that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept the word of the LORD, to do after all that is written in this book.
verses.web: “Go inquire of LORD for me, and for those who are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning the words of the book that is found; for great is LORD’s wrath that is poured out on us, because our fathers have not kept LORD’s word, to do according to all that is written in this book.”
verses.ct: "Go and seek the LORD's guidance for me and for everyone still left in Israel and Judah about what this book says. The LORD's anger against us must be enormous, because our ancestors didn't obey the LORD's word or follow anything written in this book."

verses.kjv: And Hilkiah, and they that the king had appointed, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college:) and they spake to her to that effect.
verses.web: So Hilkiah, and they whom the king had commanded, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe (now she lived in Jerusalem in the second quarter), and they spoke to her to that effect.
verses.ct: So Hilkiah and the men the king had sent went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum son of Tikvath and grandson of Hasrah, who was keeper of the wardrobe. She lived in the second district of Jerusalem. They told her what had happened.

verses.kjv: And she answered them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Tell ye the man that sent you to me,
verses.web: She said to them, “LORD, the God of Israel says: ‘Tell the man who sent you to me,
verses.ct: She replied, "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: Tell the man who sent you to me,

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah:
verses.web: “LORD says, ‘Behold, I will bring evil on this place, and on its inhabitants, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah.
verses.ct: 'The LORD says: I am going to bring disaster on this place and its people — every curse written in the book that was read to the king of Judah.

verses.kjv: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, and shall not be quenched.
verses.web: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath is poured out on this place, and it will not be quenched.’ ” ’
verses.ct: Because they abandoned me and burned incense to other gods, provoking my anger with everything they've done, my fury will be poured out on this place and will not be put out.'

verses.kjv: And as for the king of Judah, who sent you to enquire of the LORD, so shall ye say unto him, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel concerning the words which thou hast heard;
verses.web: But to the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of LORD, you shall tell him this, ‘LORD, the God of Israel says: “About the words which you have heard,
verses.ct: "But to the king of Judah, who sent you to seek the LORD's word, tell him this: 'The LORD, the God of Israel, says regarding the words you heard:

verses.kjv: Because thine heart was tender, and thou didst humble thyself before God, when thou heardest his words against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, and humbledst thyself before me, and didst rend thy clothes, and weep before me; I have even heard thee also, saith the LORD.
verses.web: because your heart was tender, and you humbled yourself before God, when you heard his words against this place, and against its inhabitants, and have humbled yourself before me, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me, I also have heard you,” says LORD.
verses.ct: Because your heart was tender and you humbled yourself before God when you heard his words against this place and its people — because you humbled yourself before me, tore your clothes, and wept in my presence — I have heard you,' declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thine eyes see all the evil that I will bring upon this place, and upon the inhabitants of the same. So they brought the king word again.
verses.web: “Behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you will be gathered to your grave in peace. Your eyes won’t see all the evil that I will bring on this place and on its inhabitants.” ’ ” They brought back word to the king.
verses.ct: 'I will let you die in peace and be buried with your ancestors. You won't have to witness all the disaster I'm going to bring on this place and its people.'" They brought this message back to the king.

verses.kjv: Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.web: Then the king sent and gathered together all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Then the king summoned all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And the king went up into the house of the LORD, and all the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the priests, and the Levites, and all the people, great and small: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: The king went up to LORD’s house, with all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the priests, the Levites, and all the people, both great and small; and he read in their hearing all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: The king went up to the LORD's house, along with all the men of Judah, the residents of Jerusalem, the priests, the Levites, and all the people — from the most important to the least. He read aloud to them every word of the book of the covenant that had been found in the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: And the king stood in his place, and made a covenant before the LORD, to walk after the LORD, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant which are written in this book.
verses.web: The king stood in his place, and made a covenant before LORD, to walk after LORD, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant that were written in this book.
verses.ct: The king stood in his place and made a covenant before the LORD to follow the LORD and to obey his commands, his decrees, and his laws with all his heart and all his soul, and to carry out everything written in this book.

verses.kjv: And he caused all that were present in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand to it. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.
verses.web: He caused all who were found in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand. The inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: He had everyone in Jerusalem and Benjamin commit to it as well. The people of Jerusalem lived according to the covenant of God, the God of their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that pertained to the children of Israel, and made all that were present in Israel to serve, even to serve the LORD their God. And all his days they departed not from following the LORD, the God of their fathers.
verses.web: Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that belonged to the children of Israel, and made all who were found in Israel to serve, even to serve LORD their God. All his days they didn’t depart from following LORD, the God of their fathers.
verses.ct: Josiah removed every detestable idol from all the territories belonging to the people of Israel and required everyone in Israel to serve the LORD their God. For the rest of his life, the people did not turn away from following the LORD, the God of their ancestors.
